   Transferred from: [**Hospital **]
   Transferred to: [**Hospital Ward Name **]  3
   Date & time of Transfer:
   55 yr old with PMH diffuse CAD, stent to LAD, presents with several
   days SOB, worsening on day of admission, reports having stopped taking
   his  meds including lasix for past 2 wks. Had CP 2 wks ago lasting 4
   days, which pt attributes to muscle strain, it did get  better with
   NSAIDS. On arrival pt tachypneic, 100% NRB, hypertensive to 240/110,
   started on Nitro drip  and given lasix with good effect. To CCU with
   Hypertension, Pulmonary edema evaluate  for ACS,  hyperglycemic was on
   insulin drip. Pt has history of noncompliance.
   Coronary artery disease (CAD, ischemic heart disease)
   Assessment:
   PT with SOB on admission, went to Cath, Has 3 VD, Plan is for CABG Dr.
   [**Last Name (STitle) 3012**] [**Name (STitle) 1088**].  Pt weaned off nitro, continues on heparin, pain free
   and breathing easier today, o2 on room air 94-96 percent OOB to chair.
   Pt peak CPK 250 NSTEMI. Creatinine up post cath.
   Action:
   Continue activity as tolerated, continue med teaching, assess for CP,
   CHF.
   Response:
   No CP or SOB
   Plan:
   Surgery [**Name (STitle) 1088**]  continue IV heparin , PTT 70 this Am,  will recheck in
   afternoon sent at 1:30 PM,  monitor hemodynamics closely. Checked PTT @
   1330, look for results,  had cath yesterday eval r groin site. Due for
   carotid U/S pre op.  Hold [**Last Name (un) **] and ACE inhibitors secondary to renal
   failure post cath.
   Hyperglycemia
   Assessment:
   FS ranging 123-248,prior to cath, HGA1C was 9.0 PT has history of med
   noncompliant,  was on insulin drip weaned off  overnight  FS 118 at
   0700 this AM. Then 248 this afternoon pre lunch.
   Action:
   Titrating his home insulin  received his
 dose this Am, also SS
   insulin,  pt eating today and we are doing Q6 hour FS.
   Response:
   Glucose appears to be  adequately controlled, but may increase dose
   will update team, continue follow.
   Plan:
   Restarted on home insulin
 dose today as diet has now been resumed.
   Cont  sliding scale, q6 hr FS
   Hypertension, benign
   Assessment:
   BP 147/78  187/93  SBP trending lower added toprol XL,  norvasc, on
   increased dose Hydralazine Q 6 hours. Weaned off nitro drip last night.
   Action:
   BP 147/78  187/93  added toprol XL today ,  norvasc, on increased dose
   Hydralazine Q 6 hours. Weaned off nitro drip last night.
   Response:
   SBP now within goal of 140-160
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor BP closely,  maintain goal SBP 140-160 Hold [**Last Name (un) **] and ACE
   inhibitors secondary to renal failure post cath
